result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Theodore M Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court orders the $500.00 cash bond on file be applied to the court costs.

2.  Random urinalysis.

5.  Expungement upon successful completion of probation.

records.addlTxt:
9:13 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  State recites plea agreement - defendant will plea to count 2, with no place enhancer and probation, with the balance of the counts being dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Selsing concurs.  Derfendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2 as PTAC and orders strikes the place enhancer.  Court orders counts 1, 3 & 4 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Selsing.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

5 months county jail, with huber and to commence within 60 days.
Court costs.
No Contact with co-defendant Andrew Mancl.
Random urinalysis.
Defendant is to obtain and maintain full time employment.
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
Expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Court grants the defendant 2 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 9:25 a.m.

10:41 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Selsing - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Selsing and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Selsing enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for Status Hearing on July 6, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:43 a.m.

2:21 p.m.  2:18 P.M.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney John Selsing present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Selsing - called and talked with the defendant.  Court sets for Status Hearing on May 5, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:21 p.m.
Status hearing on March 16, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

1:38 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court notes bond has been set.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on March 16, 2015 at 1:00  p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:41 p.m.

Defendant is to have NO CONTACT with Andrew M.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  (Not a condition) Defendant may reside at the residence.

Defendant is to have NO CONTACT with Andrew M.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  (Not a condition) Defendant may reside at the residence.

Defendant is to have NO CONTACT with Andrew M.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  (Not a condition) Defendant may reside at the residence.

1:07 p.m.  Defendant in custody and via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause.  Court questions defendant regarding address and employment.  Statement by defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation - requests a $500.00 cash bond.  Court sets bond at $500.00 cash and conditions of:  Defendant is to have NO CONTACT with Andrew M.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  (Not a condition) Defendant may reside at the residence.  Defendant is to return to court on February 23, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:30 p.m.
